  physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph
 showing a funeral procession. The photograph shows a hearse surrounded by a crowd of people. The men are standing on the left

  sgcool_label_text: The photograph shows a hearse surrounded by family members of the departed wearing mourning garments
 during the funeral of Mrs Tan Bang Wan. This photograph came from the collection of Botan House
 the ancestral home built by Tan Kim Tian in 1883 at the corner of Neil Road and Craig Road (since demolished). Together with his son Tan Beng Wan
 Tan Kim Tian founded Tan Kim Tian and Son Steamship Company in 1871
 which was one of the first in Singapore to buy and build ships. He was also the first president of the Tan clan temple.

metadata.title_text: Mrs Tan Beng Wan's Funeral Procession Photograph of a funeral procession
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph, showing a funeral procession. The photograph shows a hearse surrounded by a crowd of people. The men are standing on the left, while the women are standing on the right. The people are wearing mourning garments.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: The photograph shows a hearse surrounded by family members of the departed wearing mourning garments, during the funeral of Mrs Tan Bang Wan. This photograph came from the collection of Botan House, the ancestral home built by Tan Kim Tian in 1883 at the corner of Neil Road and Craig Road (since demolished). Together with his son Tan Beng Wan, Tan Kim Tian founded Tan Kim Tian and Son Steamship Company in 1871, which was one of the first in Singapore to buy and build ships. He was also the first president of the Tan clan temple.
